attributes.action: Anti Jump baricades around Sherley Park Bridge in st helens merseyside
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Boxing day 26/12/2021 myself and another gentleman pulled a young lady from the sherldey park bridge. This bridge runs across the link road in st helens merseyside
I am a RMN i have heard countless cases, it was this gentlemans 3rd, please put anti jump barriers on this bridge.
I have know unnumerous attempts, i have seen the destruction. Not just from families, but the people who have witnessed these attempts. This bridge is netorious and with the suicide rates are high its serious!
attributes.background: Boxing day 2021 myself and another gentleman pulled a young lady from this bridge, i was an off duty RMN in the area, i know this is a go tool stop for suicides/suicide attempts, we have the highest rates in the northwest. We need anti jump barriers on this bridge, it is netorious and we need help!

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about improvements to local roads are a matter for the local traffic authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
